titleStmt.title: The copie of a letter, lately sent to an honourable person in England, from the campe before Graue, dated the 23. day of August last past Wherein is described the good successe both of her Maiesties forces and his Excellencies against the Admirant, with his going away from the Graue. Also a thanks-giuing for the victory God gaue his Princely Excellencie, in the ouercomming and taking the said citie Graue, the 20. of September, stilo nouo. 1602. Truely translated out of the Dutch copie.
titleStmt.author: W. C., fl. 1602.

publicationStmt.publisher: By Simon Stafford, dwelling in Hosier lane neere Smith-field,

notesStmt.note: "A thankes-giuing for the victorie God gaue his princely Excellencie, in the ouercomming and taking the citie Graue, the twentieth of September. 1602" has separate pagination; register is continuous.
Identified as STC 12195 on UMI microfilm reel 1238.
Reproductions of the original in the Bodleian Library.
Appears at reel 1129 and at reel 1238 (same copy filmed twice).
